metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2626 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that libICE before 1.0.9-8 used a weak entropy to generate keys. A local attacker could potentially use this flaw for session hijacking using the information available from the process list.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2626` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libice6 - 2:1.0.9-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libice package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.0.9-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
